summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic review of three electronic devices (hard drives) seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy, specifically targeting communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs involving Epstein, his co-conspirators, and victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; his private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, was searched, and devices were seized from there. The warrant seeks evidence of his co-conspirators and offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses, authorizing a search for evidence of their communications and joint activities.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, seizing three electronic hard drives.

events.title: Period of Investigative Scope
events.description: The warrant authorizes a search for evidence of crimes spanning from 1994 through August 8, 2019, covering a 25-year period relevant to the alleged offenses.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's private residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: Three specific hard drives (Seagate Path 100) were seized from a bookshelf cabinet in an oval study on the first floor of Epstein's New York home on July 11, 2019.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence concerning her.
The search targets evidence of specific federal crimes: sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (ยง 2422), enticement to travel (ยง 2423), and conspiracy (ยง 371).

The list of items to be searched for includes communications among co-conspirators, financial payment records, travel documents for victims, and nude or sexually suggestive photographs of individuals who appear to be teenage girls or younger.
The document indicates the warrant was filed under seal and authorized delayed notice to the person whose property was searched, suggesting concerns about compromising the investigation.
